artist: Artist: William S. Henry; Publisher: Family Dog Productions, San Francisco
creditline: Gift of Paul Maurer and Scott West
description: fuchsia, orange, purple, turquoise; geometric lines and rectangles with radiating letters of various typefaces; central photographic image of a woman's face, upside down, in fuchsia on orange; white typewritten text at bottom
image_copyright: © Chet Helms DBA Family Dog Productions. All Rights Reserved
provenance: Paul Maurer, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2019.
text: In this eye-dazzling concert poster by Bill Henry, both the barely discernable central image of a silent film actress (inverted) and the various text elements take a back seat to the contrasting arrays of brilliant reds and blues that give the appearance of a deeply receding pictorial space. Likely meant to resemble the interior of an early movie theater, the visual effects of the “vibrating” color scheme are the most memorable aspects of Henry’s innovative design.
title: "One Hundred Six," Youngbloods, Mount Rushmore, Phoenix, February 16-18, Avalon Ballroom
